I love food and I love eating new things in new places. I still can't believe my luck that I spent the better part of three years living in the wonderful city of New Orleans, sleeping on an air mattress so I could spend all of my money eating interesting meals like gas station boudin or Commander's Palace turtle soup. 
 
Unfortunately, as a side effect of this life-span shortening life style (and possibly from IPAs, sazeracs, and red wine) I found that I was having a tough time keeping it all straight. After a point, there's just no way you can remember what was when and where with who. Since I think that eating good food, especially in the company of good people, is one of the greatest gifts you can ask for in life, forgetting these meals is a true sin to me. 
 
I made a few valiant efforts at carrying a notebook, but I was always caught without it. I tried tracking meals and photos in apps meant for general note taking, but it is slow, cumbersome, and clunky. I wanted a better way. And, since I no longer have the distraction of New Orleans food and nightlife and I might be mildly obsessive when I have projects in mind, this is my attempt at a better way of remembering meals. 
 
This program is a whole hearted effort to solve an admittedly first world problem and get a chance to learn some new skills along the way. I am not a programmer by education or occupation, but I have used this app as a proving ground to learn. I have attempted to make a solid, usable product that I can build and improve on in future versions. Although I have tested it for stability and usability concerns, there is a chance you might find a few bugs and glitches here and there. Please, let me know what you see and I'll do my best to correct them. Along with this, I will be updating and improving the user interface to make it as efficient as possible. And hopefully prettier, too. 
 
Now that I have this tool that I wanted, I no longer live in New Orleans and I try to spend some money on things other than restaurants, things like new clothes and actual furniture. Even though I may be missing a few meals from my journal, I hope it's something you find useful. 
 
Please let me know your thoughts, questions, comments, or complaints. 
Andy Terbovich

What is this? How to track a Memory Bite Memory Bite is a quick, lightweight food journal which tracks photos and notes of different meals, lets you quickly flip through your previous meals, and share with friends and family. It is intended to be fast and unobtrusive so that you can make entries without interrupting your meal.
